meanings.definition: A person who herds and tends cattle, especially in the western US.
meanings.sent1: The cowboys rode their horses across the vast prairie.
meanings.sent2: The cowboys rounded up the cattle at dawn.
meanings.sent3: The cowboys tried to lasso the moon for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the office, he was the cowboy of the sales team, always leading the charge.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cowboys on horseback stayed etched in her memory.

meanings.definition: A reckless or unscrupulous person, especially in business or politics.
meanings.sent1: The cowboys of Wall Street took risky bets that paid off.
meanings.sent2: The political cowboy made bold decisions without considering the consequences.
meanings.sent3: The cowboy of a salesman tried to sell ice to an Eskimo.
meanings.sent4: She was a cowboy in negotiations, always pushing for more.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy of a CEO rode roughshod over his employees' concerns.
